title: Why You Should Go Glamping In India This Year (Sougata Das)
text: By Sougata Das Oct 3, 2015 You really shouldn't need reasons to try the amazing experience of luxury camping in India. But if you do, we're giving you two:To stay on top of the latest travel trendsLuxury camping tours are the latest trend and are taking the world by quite a storm. As a discerning traveller, it is important that you stay on top of the latest trends. And now that glamping in India is finally a possibility, it's an opportunity you simply cannot afford to miss. The term 'glamping is coined by joining the words 'glamour' and 'camping'. These two opposite worlds have been clubbed together to provide an incredibly novel experience. Imagine yourself in the great outdoors, getting close to nature, thriving on your sense of adventure or serenely gathering your thoughts in beautiful surroundings. Now imagine revelling in comfort, having a range of facilities and services at your fingertips and enjoying the finer things in life. Finally, there comes an experience that doesn't make you have to choose between these two amazing situations that you just thought about. You can revel in comfort while being in the great outdoors, you can feed your sense of adventure and still have numerous services and facilities at your fingertips, you can enjoy the finer things in life right in the midst of breathtaking natural surroundings. Sounds fantastic? Sounds just like luxury camping tours.To discover the beauty of your own country:As mentioned before, you no longer have to visit another country to experience world-class luxury camps anymore, as they are available right here, in India. Ladakh is one of the best places you can go luxury camping in India. Set in the scenic location of the Himalayas, Ladakh in the northern part of Jammu and Kashmir provides a stunning spectacle no matter where you look. The striking moon-like landscape of this place is sure to captivate you, as are the snow-capped peaks, frothing rivers, majestic monasteries, rustic villages and numerous trekking trails that surround the campsite. The soil in Ladakh shines seven different shades and as you look over the stunning land while relaxing in your private deck in a fully furnished individual tent, you'll realise that this is truly as good as life could possibly get, and the country you live in has truly been blessed with nature's choicest bounty. About the Author Sougata Das works as a Web UI Designer / Developer with Cox & Kings. An ardent photographer, nature enthusiast and trekker, he loves to travel. He recently returned from one of the luxury camping tours and in this article he shares two great reasons why discerning travellers should go glamping in India this year. Rating:
